item.title: We Need a Code of Ethics.
item.description: Tech has got to get a code of ethics, ffs.

item.title: The Prime Directive and the limits of assuming positive intent
item.description: I tackled the notion of assuming positive intent when it comes to conflict. It isn’t as good an idea as you might think.

item.title: Black Mirror brainstorms — a product design exercise (UX Collective)
item.description: I want to have more ethical products. I feel like we all do. Sometimes, though, we don’t consider how this amazing thing we’re working on might have some unintended and negative consequences.

item.title: I turned off my push notifications and I’ve never been happier
item.description: One of many things I tried to reclaim my sanity from push notification hell.

item.title: Notifications stress me out. How I cut them down to improve my well-being (CBC Radio)
item.description: I was interviewed by CBC to discuss push notificaitons and the stress they cause.

item.title: Push Notifications, the good, the bad, and the wtf could u not (UX Collective)
item.description: Why you should give people more control over the notifications they receive from you.

item.title: Giving Your Product A Soul (Smashing Magazine)
item.description: I wrote about why it’s important that the products we make have a little personality. Not delight, but soul.

item.title: One idea that could curb harassment on social media
item.description: I’ve always been thinking about how to reduce harassment and annoyance on the web, here are some early thoughts.

item.title: Tips for perfect readability with a little help from The Big Lebowski
item.description: Written shortly after the release of my first typeface, Uptown Sans. I ended up giving a talk on this at GIANTConf in Charleston, SC.

item.title: How To Make An Effective Style Guide With Adobe Fireworks (Smashing Magazine)
item.description: Style guides and Adobe Fireworks. This article is old, but one of my first ever published.

item.title: iOS Grid System, A Free Extension For Adobe Fireworks (Smashing Magazine)
